intro: Brachyphragma mohavense, commonly known as Mohave brachyphragma, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, known for its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and heat. Its leaves are usually small and succulent, helping to conserve water. The flowers, which are often blue or purple, bloom in late spring and early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
